articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: Julia Parish
articles.contents:
Education
Master of Environmental Data Science | Expected 2022  Bren School of Environmental Science & Management  University of California, Santa Barbara
Bachelor of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies| May 2007  Emphasis: Environmental Studies  University of Hawaii at Manoa
Professional Experience
American Conservation Experience | San Diego, CA Restoration Specialist | April 2020 to July 2021
Served as the project manager for two field crews controlling two invasive species, velvet tree (Miconia calvescens), and coqui frog (Eleutherodactylus coqui) on the island of Maui, Hawaii.
Assisted with designing digital project databases and determining project measurables to collect field data using tablet devices.
American Conservation Experience | San Diego County, CA Director | June 2018 to March 2020
Annually contracted $1.2m in conservation projects on federal, state, county, and private lands.
Solicited, planned, scheduled, and tracked restoration and trail projects implemented by over 100 conservation corpsmembers.
Catalina Island Conservancy | Avalon, CA Plant Conservation Manager | April 2015 to June 2018
Facilitated the recovery of chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats by directing implementing an invasive plant management program.
Updated and managed the invasive plant project ArcGIS and Access databases.
Oahu Invasive Species Committee | Honolulu, HI Manager | December 2012 to April 2015
Performed strategic planning, fundraising, and public outreach functions surrounding the eradication of highly invasive plant species.
Raised $1.2M funding in one year through competitive grant proposals.
Center for Conservation Research and Training at the University of Hawaii, Kure Atoll Wildlife Sanctuary | Honolulu, HI CCRT Field Project Support Assistant | August 2010 to December 2012
Implemented the first two years of a 10-year restoration project to eradicate Golden crownbeard (Verbesina encelioides) using manual, mechanical, and chemical methodologies on a remote atoll in Papahanumokuakea Marine National Monument.
Organized three seasonal remote field camps by recruiting two staff and eight volunteers, coordinating transit from Honolulu to Kure Atoll, and procuring supplies over a two-year period.
Collected and analyzed data on the life history and ecology of seabirds, plants, mammals, and other wildlife species.
Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands | Hilo, HI Incipient Weed Control Biologist | Research Assistant II | November 2008 to July 2010
Created the incipient invasive species detection program for the Department of Defense’s 53,823-hectare Pohakuloa Training Area (PTA) military base.
Managed spatial data for the incipient invasive plant program in ArcGIS and a Microsoft Access database.
Oahu Invasive Species Committee | Honolulu, HI Outreach Specialist | December 2007 to November 2008
Managed database of private property owners, outreach events, and volunteer lists in Microsoft Access.
Answered public inquiries about invasive species and natural resource management with professionalism.
Collaborated with outside agencies to prioritize State-wide outreach needs and goals.
Oahu Invasive Species Committee | Honolulu, HI AmeriCorps Field Technician Member | December 2006 - November 2007
Certifications and Licenses
Mental Health First Aid USA, 2021
California Qualified Applicator License, 2017
United States Geological Services Brown Treesnake Rapid Response Team, 2014
Publications
Duffy, D., Elliott, D., Hart, G.M., Gunderson, K., Aguon-Kona, J., Bartlett, R., Fujikawa, J., Gmelin, P., Javier, C., Kaneholani, I., Keanini, T., Kona, J., Parish, J., Penniman, J.F., and Works, A.,2015, “Has the Small Indian Mongoose Become Established on Kauai Island, Hawaii?” Pacific Science, Vol. 69, Issue 4
Articles
Mazurkiewicz, D., Adams, J., Ball, M., Carle, R., Dixon P., Flagg, K., Havstad, E., Howe, E., Hoyer, B., Knapp, J., McEachern, K., Luna-Mendoza, L., Munson, B., Niessen, K., Owen, K., Parish, J., Power, P., Yamagiwa, A., 2017, “Restoration and Protection of the Archipelago’s Flora and Habitats: A New Era,” Fremontia/California Native Plant Society, Vol. 45/No. 3
Parish, J. 2010. “Targeting Pohakuloa’s “Most Un-Wanted”: The Incipient Weed Program at PTA.” Ecosystems Management Program Bulletin 48:4-6.
Presentations & Posters
Parish, J. “Implementing an Early Detection Program on Catalina Island: Prioritizing Landscaped Grasses,” Poster, Island Invasives Symposium. Dundee, Scotland. July 2017
Parish, J. “Prioritizing Miconia calvescens Survey on Oahu,” Presentation, California Invasive Plant Council Symposium, San Diego, CA. October 2015
Parish, J. “The Incipient Weed Program at Pohakuloa Training Area, Hilo, HI.” Poster. Hawaii Conservation Conference. Honolulu, HI August 2010
Parish, J. and Fincher, R. M. “Bioassay of Secondary Metabolites in Ethnobotanically Important Plant Species: The detection and response of Paraponera clavata to chemical compounds in ethnobotanically important plant species.” NSF REU Internship Summer Research Presentation La Selva Biological Field Station Puerto Viejo de Sarapiqui, Costa Rica. August 2006
Honors and Awards
National Science Foundation and Duke University Research Education for Undergraduates Internship award: Puerto Viejo de Sarapiqui, Costa Rica June 2006
University of Hawaii School for Ocean Ecology, Science and Technology Tuition Waiver for Academic Excellence: Honolulu, HI Fall 2005
University of Hawaii Dean’s List: Honolulu, HI Spring 2004 – Spring 2005
Benjamin Gillman International Scholarship: Honolulu, HI August 2004
Professional Affiliations
Member, Board Member, Secretary, President | California Invasive Plant Council 2017 – Present
Member | California Native Plant Society – Channel Islands, South Coast, San Diego Chapters 2016 – Present
Member | Society for Ecological Restoration 2019 – 2021
Member | San Diego County Weed Management Area 2018 – 2021
Board Member | Friends of the Hawaiian Island National Wildlife Refuges 2017 – 2019
Member | Board Member, Southern California Botanical Society 2017 - 2018
Member | Los Angeles County Weed Management Area 2015 - 2018
Member | Coordinating Group on Alien Pest Species 2008, 2013
Member | Hawaii Invasive Species Council Working Groups 2008, 2013
Member | Oahu Coqui Frog Working Group 2013
Volunteer | Midway Atoll National Wildlife Refuge 2010, 2011, 2012

articles.title: Julia Parish
articles.contents:
Julia Parish
          
          
          About
          CV
          Blog
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Julia Parish
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        LinkedIn

                        GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        iNaturalist
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Biography
            I am currently a candidate for a master’s in Environmental Data Science at the Bren School of Environmental Science and Management at the University of California Santa Barbara. Since graduating from the University of Hawaii at Manoa with a B.A. in Environmental Studies, I have led field teams to enhance biological diversity, ecosystem health, and cultural and recreational resources on islands in the Pacific region and throughout Southern California. While working Pohakuloa Training Area on Hawaii Island, I developed and implemented an invasive plant early detection and rapid response program, which involved establishing data collection and mapping standards. This experience solidified my passion for collecting and maintaining tidy data. I am an experienced Program Director with expertise in grant writing, project management, and invasive biology. After obtaining my master’s, I will focus on aiding land managers and conservation organizations with developing management priorities based on data science tools and analysis. When not working, I can be found in the ocean, playing capoeira, or volunteering on a remote atoll surrounded by thousands of seabirds.
            
            
            Education
            Bren School for Environmental Science and Management | Santa Barbara, CA     M.A. in Environmental Data Science | Expected 2022
            The University of Hawaii at Manoa | Honolulu, HI     B.A. in Environmental Studies | 2004 - 2007
